mn126:2.1: We know Bhūmija from [sn12.25](), where he asks Sāriputta about the efficacy of deeds.
mn126:4.1: Like Aciravata in [mn125:3.2](), he is cautious in responding.
mn126:4.3: “Irrationally” here means, as the Sutta will make clear, that the practices one does are not “rationally” or causally connected to the results one expects.
